indoo.rs for Android

This is the indoor API for the android platform.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
com.customlbs.coordinates  
com.customlbs.library
Provides the classes necessary to create an indoors powered app and the classes an app uses to communicate with the indoors service.
com.customlbs.library.callbacks  
com.customlbs.library.model
Provides the model classes necessary to communicate with the indoors service.
com.customlbs.library.util  
com.customlbs.shared  
com.customlbs.shared.geo  
com.customlbs.surface.library  
This is the indoor API for the android platform.

As shown in the figure below it provides the basic interface to connect to the library.

Start with:

  • IndoorsFactory.createInstance(Context, String, IndoorsServiceCallback)
  • Indoors
  • Indoors.registerLocationListener(IndoorsLocationListener)


To make the Indoors instance available during the activity/fragment lifecycle the pattern shown below is recommended. All methods from any callback of the Indoors API are always called from the main thread, so you can do UI manipulations.


public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
   ...
   IndoorsFactory.createInstance(this, "xxx-xxx-xxx-xxx", serviceCallback);
}

protected void onDestroy() {
   ...
   IndoorsFactory.releaseInstance(serviceCallback);
}


private IndoorsServiceCallback serviceCallback = new IndoorsServiceCallback() {
public void onError(IndoorsException indoorsException) {
   //error handling
}
public void connected() {
   IndoorsFactory.getInstance().enableEvaluationMode(new EvaluationParameters());
   IndoorsFactory.getInstance().registerLocationListener(mAdapter);
}
};
